  • Constructor Details

    • GameTest

      public GameTest()

  • Method Details

    • setUp

      @BeforeEach public void setUp()
      Method setUp creates a new game with 4 players and an ID before each test. It checks if the game is not null and if the game's ID and the number of players are correctly set.

    • setNull

      @AfterEach public void setNull()
      Method setNull sets the game to null after each test.

    • gameConstructorTest

      @Test public void gameConstructorTest()
      Test gameConstructorTest checks if the game is created correctly. It checks if the number of players, the players' usernames, the players' shelves and the game's ID are correctly set. It also checks if the game board, the end game token, the common goal cards, the current player and the previous player are still correctly null.

    • initializeTest

      @Test public void initializeTest()
      Test initializeTest checks if the game is initialized correctly. After the initialization, the game board, the common goal cards, the current player and the personal goal cards are all correctly set. The end game token and the previous player are still correctly null.

    • chooseFirstPlayerTest

      @Test public void chooseFirstPlayerTest()
      Test chooseFirstPlayerTest checks if the first player is correctly chosen. After the first player is chosen, the current player is correctly set and the previous player is still null.

    • nextTurnTest

      @Test public void nextTurnTest()
      Test nextTurnTest checks if nextTurn() correctly sets the current player and the previous player. The current player is saved in a variable and then nextTurn() is called. It checks if the current player is different from the (old) one saved and if the previous player is the one saved.

    • scoreboardTest

      @Test public void scoreboardTest()
      Test scoreboardTest checks if the scoreboard is correctly sorted. It sets the score of the players and then checks if the scoreboard is correctly sorted in descending order with the player with the highest score in first position.

    • startGameTest

      @Test public void startGameTest()
      Test startGameTest checks if the CGCs and PGCs are correctly initialized.

    • gameHasEndedTest

      @Test public void gameHasEndedTest()
      Test gameHasEndedTest checks if the scores are correctly calculated and if the scoreBoard is correctly sorted. The second, third and fourth player get respectively 4, 5, 6 tiles of the same color on the first column of their shelf. That means the second player gets 3 points, the third 5 and the fourth 8. NB: The first player gets 0 points. Since the PGCs are randomly assigned it is possible for player 4, 3 and 2 to have plus one point each.

    • calculateScoreTest

      @Test public void calculateScoreTest()
      Test calculateScoreTest checks if the scores are correctly calculated. Each player gets 3 tiles of tile type GAMES on the third column of their shelf. Each player gets 2 points but the end game token is set to the first player who gets 1 point more.

    • generateCGCTest

      @Test public void generateCGCTest()
      Test generateCGCTest checks if the common goal cards are correctly generated.

    • generatePGCTest

      @Test public void generatePGCTest()
      Test generatePGCTest checks if the personal goal cards are correctly generated for each player.

    • insertTilesTest

      @Test public void insertTilesTest()
      Test insertTilesTest checks if the tiles are correctly inserted inside the shelf. When the shelf is full and if the end game token is still null it checks if the end game token is correctly set to the current player who has filled his shelf.
